title: ODual (1975) Genesis Portion
description: Odual (Onu Odual) is a Central Delta language spoken by the Odual community in the Abuaâ€“Odual Local Government Area of Rivers State and Ogbia LGA of Bayelsa State, Nigeria. The Odual clan is bounded in the east by the Abua villages of Ogbema, Arukwo, Ogbogolo, in the west by Oloibiri, Amurukeni in Ogbia (in Bayelsa State of Nigeria), in the north by Oruma, Ibelebiri, Kolo (also in Ogbia), and in the south by Nembe town of Oluasiri, Bassambiri, Ekpoma, Ogbolomabiri (also in Bayelsa State of Nigeria), etc.
